name: 60 Second Taste Strawberry

contraindications.text: usual approximately 2.75 - 9 grams 60 second taste per dual arch treatment ( depending tray size ) . shake well prophylaxis remove excess fluid teeth . fill applicator tray 1/3 full gel . insert filled tray patient 's mouth instruct bite gently one minute , four minutes . treatment time completed , remove tray patient expectorate residual gel . maximum benefits prevention caries , instruct patient rinse , eat drink 30 minutes . repeat treatment least twice year . patients rampant active caries , repeat treatment twice every six months . contents become frozen , warm room temperature shake well using .

contraindications_original:
Usual dosage is approximately 2.75 - 9 grams of 60 Second Taste per dual arch treatment (depending on tray size).
                  Shake well before use
                  
                     After prophylaxis remove excess fluid from teeth.
                     Fill applicator tray 1/3 full with gel.
                     Insert filled tray into patient's mouth and instruct to bite down gently for one minute, or up to four minutes.
                     After treatment time is completed, remove tray and have patient expectorate residual gel.
                     For maximum benefits for the prevention of caries, instruct patient not to rinse, eat or drink for 30 minutes.
                  
                  Repeat treatment at least once or twice a year. For patients with rampant or active caries, repeat treatment once or twice every six months.
                  If contents have become frozen, warm to room temperature and shake well before using.
adverseReactions_original: Contraindicated in individuals who are hypersensitive to fluoride.
